info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Archuleta County through 500 PM MDT... At 407 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Wolf Creek Pass to Pagosa Springs to 16 miles east of Bayfield. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar and satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pagosa Springs, Chimney Rock and Lonetree. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 84 in Colorado between mile markers 11 and 27. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 116 and 152. Colorado 151 between mile markers 27 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
